page.title: 14Industrial history (cont'd)
page.content: In 1818 the Sirhowy Ironworks passed to Mr. Harford and the Ebbw Vale works:this the town into two groups in that Sirhowy and Dukestown belonged to EVale whilst the rest of the town owed its allegiaance to the Tredegar Iron Company. In 1910 the Tredegar Ironworks was closed and was moved to Newport.This was due to the fact that the works had never converted to the Bessemer or Open hearth processes and were unable to make steel. It is from this period of time that the gradual decline of the town started. In the 30's to help a depressed area Ebbw Vale steelworks (Richard Thomas and Baldwins) was moved from Gorseinon.This works was eventually to employ 10,000 men and bring prosperity back to the area.
